Description: Peasant's robe, gellabia; woven of goat hair; multiple pieces of black cloth sewn together to make A-shaped garment with wide sleeves; V-neck cut for neck opening; slits on bottom corners; neck area and slits at bottom edge lined with purple calico printed with white and red flowers.
Curator's comments: Slip reads: "Robe made of black goat's hair, lined with printed calico, worn by Egyptian Fellahs. Sent by Abbas Pacha to London Exhibition of 1851, value 65 Piastres - 13 shillings. It is a long gown with opening in upper part of front and has wide sleeves".
